newsitem.title: USA: Nike sees Q4 EPS $0.51-$0.56 after charge.
newsitem.headline: Nike sees Q4 EPS $0.51-$0.56 after charge.

text.p: Nike Inc said Thursday it expects earnings for the fourth quarter ending May 31 of $0.51 to $0.56 per share, below analysts' consensus estimate of $0.69.

Nike said the estimates included a one-time pre-tax charge of $18 million, or $0.04 per share. The charge is primarily related to the shutdown of a manufacturing facility at the company's Bauer Inc unit as part of a long-term plan to reposition some manufacturing facilities to more cost-effective overseas operations, Nike said.

The company also said its revenues would be below analysts' estimates for the quarter amid "shifts in the mix of futures and at-once orders, timing of shipments in Europe, product shortages, and a slight increase in U.S. order cancellations."
Despite the warnings on the fourth quarter, Nike said its projected revenues and earnings for the full fiscal year would be up more than 40 percent from fiscal 1996.
It said it expects revenue growth in fiscal 1998 in excess of its previously stated long-term annual goal of 15 percent.
Nike said it expects to report fourth quarter results in early July.
Nike shares rose 3-1/2 Wednesday to 63-1/2 on speculation that billionaire investor Warren Buffett likes Nike as an investment. On Tuesday the stock gained 3-3/4.
